name: nyu
text: What?

name: saint
text: I WILL GET THE HOSE

name: fuzzyshoo
text:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lovely_Bones_%28film%29

Mr. Tucci is nominated for many awards in his role.

name: songbirdspectre
text: yeah, this one is beyond me.

name: delete
text: A comment left by delete was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by divot, rowboat, Albatross)

name: rowboat
text: A comment left by rowboat was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by AdrianMiller, fallow_fields, NeoNaoNeo, clancine, lateadopter, HollyBones, w_t_f, ovenface)

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
It is achewood realismo-absurdism. It is not supposed to be funny.It is supposed to give you an unforgiving look at yourself.
When you are not home, anyone can come to the door. Nobody is at the door when you are home.

name: rowboat
text: Thanks. I've been wondering about that all year.

name: rasalghul
text: Nobody but your stuffed animals.

name: benhead
text: Is that like Achewood Magical Realism?

name: gormster
text: man i can type "wp stanley tucci" into my address bar good as anyone else

name: deimosrising
text: First reference to the humans; I am ambivalent towards this development.

name: prius_chaser
text: The joke is that Stanley Tucci came to the door, but since no one was home, he left. On the whole, I'd say it's a pretty "Achewood" moment.

name: em2
text:
Wake up! Wake up!

Wha...? What is it, Lie Bot?

Stanley Tucci's here! He wants to see you!

Really? Wow!

He has a blinking tooth!

That's so awesome!

name: gusplease
text: A comment left by gusplease was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Tinhand, TheGrouch, Jesler729, Deusoma, NYU, equinn2006, aesop_punk, Doc_Rostov, motts, morbo, Darthemed)

name: townsend
text: I couldn't agree more. This should be AT LEAST a 3.5 but you people ruined it. This is why Stanley Tucci doesn't visit anymore.

name: billyamericana
text: Something tells me Chris would really like to meet Stanley Tucci.

name: mortshire
text: at least stanley tucci's still getting good work.

name: speedwell
text: He's "raising the bar" as we speak.

name: a_dude
text: Phillipe is nice to people.

name: a_dude
text: A comment left by a_dude was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Tinhand, alejandroadam, mrn, I_Love_Kate, Garyos)

name: mustafaqbrainmender
text: This is the straight kridden comic platinum.

name: tetrisattack
text: This one is the best.

name: direhaggis
text: No punchline but pure Achewood. I mean sometimes Stanley Tucci just shows up and knocks and leaves in life.

name: tekende
text: Sometimes he leaves flaming bags of dog poop on your porch. These things happen.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
And sometimes he eats, shoots & leaves.

Tucci likes to keep you guessing.

name: shoinan
text: Achewood was pretty weird during the first year... But it did establish the idea that the stuffed animals cannot meet humans.

name: gouldgonewild
text: ...unless they are dead? or from other cartoons? Or Onstad? I don't know, humans are in it a lot, it seems...and what the hell is Cartilage Head?

name: wonelove
text:
Cartilage Head is...
...well, Cartilage Head

name: atticusonline
text: Stanley is 46...the animals know him.

name: shutup_shutup
text:
That's Stanley Tucci. I know him.

I know Stanley Tucci.

name: atticusonline
text: Yes.

name: thisdoggisproice
text: I liked Stanley Tucci in Big Night, too.  My dog better tell me if he shows up or I will be angrier than a nest of angry hornets at the angry farm on angry day.

name: envika
text: This one's good because you don't need to know who Stanley Tucci is to get it.

name: stuart
text: Have you guys noticed the crazy ass patterns the halftone makes in these?

name: tekende
text: Whoa! Weird!

name: sankster
text: I dunno, I liked this strip. There's just something really funny about the anticlimax to me. I've seen it mentioned elsewhere, but the humor is in the specifics. Stanley Tucci is specifically mentioned, so you expect a joke related to him or one of his movies, may be even "Big Night." Then, suddenly, he leaves instead. I think it's the fact that Onstad DIDN'T go with what's expected that makes this one funny.

name: i_pose_4_nolan
text: This is just... Hmm. I enjoy Achewood, and read every day. This is actually my third read-through. And whilst I can understand that Onstad may still have been carving his niche, this just seems like nothing.

name: mattylite
text: I love that other than the otter's wave, they don't move at all.  I think they were already standing in the window, and they just take it in stride when the somewhat famous middle-brow actor shows up.  Cornelius all back-of-the-rental-box style.  Teodore with an exclamation mark but still has his hands behind his back like some patient civil war general.

name: sparhawk
text:
The things unsaid... the deeds undone...

'Bye Stanley! Loved Shall We Dance!'

name: wonglers
text: That was just Brian, actually.  He's a Jehova's Witness.  Stuffed animals think humans all look alike.  False alarm.

name: mikeronomicon
text: I think this might actually be the only real mention of humans living with Cornelius, Teodor, and Philipe. But then again, I could be completely full of shit.

name: tekende
text: Can't it be both?

name: mikeronomicon
text: I usually assume that it is, but that's just me.

name: woodenteeth
text: Retrado. If I had no idea about Spanish I would assume this is a Retro Version of everyones favourite closet caring troll!

name: rowboat
text: Ha! I don't remember why I made a blank post here, but this is actually an account which I constructed in the service of a hilarious joke I made somewhere down the line under this strip.

name: woodenteeth
text: Too MUCH!
